alert.note: Alert for Sheridan (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 23 at 12:36AM CDT until further notice by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 AM MDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of panhandle Nebraska, including the following county, Sheridan. * WHEN...Until 245 AM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1136 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... White Clay, Pine Ridge and Intersection of Highway 87 and Craven Creek Road. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
